meanings.definition: Having a lighter complexion than usual.
meanings.sent1: She looked paler than usual after staying indoors all day.
meanings.sent2: The sky grew paler as the sun began to set.
meanings.sent3: The ghost in the movie was so paler than a sheet of paper!
meanings.sent4: Her smile was paler than a moonbeam on a cloudy night.
meanings.sent5: The paler flowers in the garden seemed to glow in the moonlight.

meanings.definition: Becoming less intense or vivid in color.
meanings.sent1: The paint on the wall was getting paler with each passing year.
meanings.sent2: The sunset turned paler as the storm clouds rolled in.
meanings.sent3: The once vibrant painting now looked paler than a washed-out rainbow.
meanings.sent4: His enthusiasm for the project grew paler as the deadlines approached.
meanings.sent5: The paler hues of the landscape hinted at the coming winter.

meanings.definition: A person who is pale in complexion.
meanings.sent1: The doctor advised the paler to avoid direct sunlight.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the paler of the group due to her fair skin.
meanings.sent3: The paler at the beach wore a wide-brimmed hat to protect her skin.
meanings.sent4: In the crowd of tanned faces, the paler stood out like a pearl.
meanings.sent5: The paler always carried sunscreen to prevent sunburn.
